title: Title
feedbackText: Thanks for the message. I will contact you by the specified email.
sendNewPasswordToEmail: Send new temporary @.lower:password by email. You can change it later in profile.
tempPasswordSent: The @.lower:password has been sent by email
followTheEmailLink: Follow the link from the mail

features.progressText: A table with exercise statistics. Charts tracking progress by workouts, sets, repetitions, and muscle groups.
features.shareText: Copy data from a completed workout in your calendar with one click, including the time of each set.
features.planText: Repeat one of your past workouts. Workout duration is estimated based on your statistics.

pwa.getNewVersion: Refresh the page to get the latest version of the app

science.title: The best workout is the one you came to!
science.researches: Studies show that tracking sets, rest periods, and load dynamics increases training efficiency by 40%. This helps avoid plateaus, reduce the risk of overtraining, and achieve your goals three months faster.

statisticsText: Exercises are grouped by muscles and selected to balance simplicity and variety of training. In the calendar you can view the visualization of the workout, its composition, the time of the approaches. Below are the general and average monthly data on the duration of workouts, the number of workouts, approaches, repetitions, rest time, and graphs with dynamics for these parameters.

The table shows exercise statistics: monthly sets and repetitions, comparison with the previous period, and average execution time and repeats in set. By clicking on an exercise, you can read about the muscles involved, the equipment, and the technique of execution.

hero.title: FiT - home workout calendar
benefits: An easy way to improve your health and mood
Calendar with planning and visualization of workouts
General and individual exercises with and without equipment
Free app for PC, Android and iOS

installText: The app can also be installed through your browser (Google Chrome on Android, Safari on iOS):
Android: Go to app-fit.ru, open the browser menu ⋮, and select 'Add to Home screen'.
iOS: Go to app-fit.ru, tap the 'Share' icon, then select 'Add to Home screen'.
PC: Go to app-fit.ru, click the 'Install' button in the browser’s address bar.
registrationText: Register by entering your name, email, and password. A confirmation link will be sent to your email. Check your spam folder if you don’t receive the email.

Log into the app. In your profile, add the equipment you have access to from the list. This determines which exercises you’ll be able to perform. Some equipment allows weight selection. For example, you might have 2 kg and 3 kg dumbbells.

If an exercise allows weight selection or you have multiple types of weighted equipment, you’ll be able to set a default weight for each such exercise. Save your changes by clicking the 'Save' button.
You can add up to 20 custom exercises via the form in your user profile. When creating an exercise, provide its name, description, equipment used, and targeted muscle groups.
activityPassingText: Add exercises by specifying the number of repetitions and available weight. You can filter exercises by muscle groups or name.
You can add 2 or 3 sets at once. If the last two exercises differ, an option to 'Add set' with the same exercises will appear.

After completing at least one workout, you can 'Repeat last activity' with one click. You can also copy any past activity via the calendar on the statistics page by clicking the 'Copy' button at the bottom of the pop-up window.

Plan future workouts. To do this, click 'Add to calendar' when creating a workout. In the calendar that appears, select a date and click 'Save activity to calendar'. You can start the workout from the calendar at any time, even if it’s not the scheduled day.

After finalizing building your workout, click 'Start activity'. The activity passing screen will appear. Tap 'Start' to activate the timer for the current exercise. If you feel the set was performed to failure, mark this option. You can adjust the number of completed repetitions. Then click 'Complete'.

After finishing the exercises, you’ll be redirected to the statistics page. Completed workouts in the calendar are color-coded based on the most engaged muscle groups. The more a muscle group is used, the larger its visual space. Activities can also be deleted from the calendar.
If you need to stop a workout early, click the 'Finish activity early' button. The timer helps predict future workout durations, track average rest times, and visualize workouts in your statistics.
